result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Russell Thomas Brownrigg

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Russell Thomas Brownrigg in court with attorney Jesse Johansen.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  2:07 PM  State recites appearances.  Also has 15 CF 297.  State recites plea - plead to NC to  count 1 in 15 CF 121 and 15 CF 297 and counts 2 and 3 in 15 CF 121.  DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  DE entered plea of NC to count 1 in 15 CF 121.  Court finds DE guilty counts 2 and 3 along with 15 CF 121 are dismissed and read-in.  

Court:  Sentence w/held 30 months probation - Child Support payments are to be made in full and on time and to pay $100.00 per month towards arrears - costs $518.00 - DNA sample/surcharge - credit for time served calculated by Sheriff's Department
Counts 2 and 3 along with 15 CF 297 are dismissed and read-in

Off the Record - Defendant Russell Thomas Brownrigg in court with attorney Jesse Johansen.  Aaron B Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 9, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
Status conference on August 3, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Russell Thomas Brownrigg in court with attorney Jesse Johansen via phone.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Johansen waived reading entered plea of not guilty.   Court NG plea entered  Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2016 at 01:45 pm.
Attorney Jesse Johansen in court via phone.  Aaron Marcoux appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Arraignment scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 03:45 pm.

Defendant Russell Thomas Brownrigg in court  by video, with attorney Jesse Johansen by phone  Defendant Russell Thomas Brownrigg in custody.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, waives preliminary hearing, court finds probable cause,  Arraignment scheduled for February 25, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

Judge by phone from Rusk County  - Defendant Russell Thomas Brownrigg in court, in custody by video.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  CBS $500.00 combined on 15cf121 and 15cf297  Initial appearance scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 04:00 pm.
